question: 造る
sourceAnswer: to{} make/produce/manufacture/build/construct | prepare-(food)/brew-(alcohol) | raise/grow/cultivate/train | till | draw-up-(a-document)/make-out/prepare/write | create-(an-artistic-work,-etc.)/compose | coin-(a-phrase)/organize/organise/establish/found | have-(a-child) | make-up-(one's-face,-etc.) | fabricate-(an-excuse,-etc.) | give-a-(false)-appearance/feign-(a-smile,-etc.)/put-on-a-show-of-emotion | form-(a-line,-etc.) | set-(a-record) | commit-(a-sin,-etc.)
userAnswer: to{} make/produce/manufacture | brew/prepare | raise/grow | till | draw-up | create ...
activeAnswer: to{} make/produce/manufacture | brew/prepare | raise/grow | till | draw-up | create ...
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>create</kanji> something you make something. This type of creation is usually for large things (perhaps ships) that you'd want <vocabulary>to manufacture</vocabulary> so you can <vocabulary>make</vocabulary> a lot of them.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is like <ja>作る</ja>, which means "to make." They have very similar meanings, but different kanji. Use <ja>作る</ja> to help you to remember the reading of this word.
